variants.explanation: We include <stdio.h> for printf, then print the two required lines. Each printf ends with a newline (\n) so the output appears on separate lines.
keyPoints: printf automatically formats strings; include \n to move to the next line
main returns 0 to signal successful execution
Two printf calls keep the messages on separate lines

variants.explanation: The program uses std::cout from <iostream> to print two lines. std::endl inserts a newline and flushes the output stream, ensuring each sentence appears on its own line.
keyPoints: Using the std:: prefix avoids bringing the whole namespace into scope
std::endl appends a newline and flushes the buffer
main must return 0 to indicate success
